'''Anastacia Lyn Newkirk''' ({{IPAc-en|ˌ|æ|n|ə|ˈ|s|t|eɪ|ʒ|ə}} {{respell|AN|ə|STAY|zhə}}; born September 17, 1968) is an American singer, songwriter and former dancer. Her first two albums ''[[Not That Kind]]'' (2000) and ''[[Freak of Nature]]'' (2001) were released in quick succession to major success. Spurred on by the multi-platinum, global smash "[[I'm Outta Love]]", Anastacia was awarded as the 'World's Best-Selling New Female Pop Artist' in 2001. Her commercial success continued with international hits such as "[[Paid My Dues]]", "[[One Day in Your Life (Anastacia song)|One Day In Your Life]]" and the official song of the [[2002 FIFA World Cup]], "[[Boom (Anastacia song)|Boom]]". After recovering from cancer, she returned with 2004's ''[[Anastacia (album)|Anastacia]]'' which deviated from previous albums into pop-rock. Peaking at number one in 11 countries, it became Europe's second-biggest-selling album of the year. Its lead single "[[Left Outside Alone]]" remained at number one on the European ''Billboard'' chart for 15 weeks and helped Anastacia launch the most successful European tour by a solo artist that same year.<ref name="anastacia.com">[http://www.anastacia.com/infos/view/bio Anastacia bio] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120108043930/http://www.anastacia.com/infos/view/bio |date=January 8, 2012}} (December 2011)</ref> The album also provided another three singles: "[[Sick and Tired (Anastacia song)|Sick and Tired]]", "[[Welcome to My Truth]]", and "[[Heavy on My Heart]]".

In 2005, the multi-platinum compilation project ''[[Pieces of a Dream (Anastacia album)|Pieces of a Dream]]'' was released, which spawned the chart-topping duet with [[Eros Ramazzotti]], "[[I Belong to You (Il Ritmo della Passione)]]". Her fourth studio album ''[[Heavy Rotation (Anastacia album)|Heavy Rotation]]'' (2008) produced the songs "[[Absolutely Positively]]", "[[Defeated (Anastacia song)|Defeated]]", and "[[I Can Feel You]]". Her cover album ''[[It's a Man's World (Anastacia album)|It's a Man's World]]'' (2012) was followed by a sixth studio album ''[[Resurrection (Anastacia album)|Resurrection]]'' (2014), which reached the top ten of several European charts. Her ''[[Ultimate Collection (Anastacia album)|Ultimate Collection]]'' was released in 2015 and peaked in the top ten of the UK charts, giving the singer her sixth top-ten album in Britain. In 2017, Anastacia released the studio album ''[[Evolution (Anastacia album)|Evolution]]'' and its lead single "[[Caught in the Middle (Anastacia song)|Caught in the Middle]]".<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.officialcharts.com/chart-news/anastacia-is-releasing-her-new-single-caught-in-the-middle-this-week-and-its-one-of-her-trademark-power-anthems__19782/|title=Anastacia is back with a brand new power anthem: Preview|access-date=July 29, 2018}}</ref> Anastacia has established herself as one of the best-selling international female singers of the 2000s and 2010s. As of 2016, she has reported worldwide sales of more than 50 million.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Smith|first=Christopher|date=September 4, 2018|title=WHERE ARE THEY NOW? Anastacia|url=https://talkaboutpopmusic.com/2018/09/04/where-are-they-now-anastacia/|access-date=December 14, 2021|website=Talk About Pop Music|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://top40-charts.com/artist.php?aid=413 |title=Anastacia Biography, Discography, Chart History |website=Top40-charts.com}}</ref> She has had five top ten singles on U.S. [[Billboard charts|''Billboard'']]'s Dance Club chart and three albums on its Top Album Sales chart.<ref>{{cite magazine |url=https://www.billboard.com/artist/anastacia/chart-history/dsi/ |title=Anastacia Chart History |magazine=Billboard |access-date=July 22, 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite magazine |url=https://www.billboard.com/artist/anastacia/chart-history/tsl/ |title=Anastacia Chart History |magazine=Billboard |access-date=July 22, 2018}}</ref>

Known for her powerful [[mezzo-soprano]] voice and her small stature of {{convert|5|ft|2|in|cm}}, she has been dubbed "the little lady with the big voice".<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.latimes.com/business/realestate/hot-property/la-fi-hotprop-anastacia-20160414-story.html |title=Singer Anastacia is taking her longtime Beverly Hills home off her tour circuit |work=[[Los Angeles Times]] |date=April 18, 2016 |access-date=March 11, 2018 |first=Lauren |last=Beale}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://renownedforsound.com/index.php/album-review-anastacia-evolution/ |title=Album Review: Anastacia – Evolution |work=Renowned for Sound |date=October 4, 2017 |access-date=March 11, 2018 |first=Haydon |last=Benfield}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.ukmusicreviews.co.uk/interviews/interview-anastacia/ |title=Interview: Anastacia |work=UK Music Reviews |date=February 8, 2017 |access-date=March 11, 2018 |first=Kevin |last=Cooper}}</ref> She underwent corrective [[LASIK]] surgery in August 2005, although she still frequently wears the glasses for which she became noted when she first became famous.

During her life Anastacia has battled many health problems. She was diagnosed with [[Crohn's disease]] when she was 13, [[breast cancer]] at the age of 34, and [[supraventricular tachycardia]] aged 39. In 2013, Anastacia was diagnosed with breast cancer for a second time. In recognition of her decade-long charitable efforts in breast cancer awareness, Anastacia became the second woman ever to be presented with the Humanitarian Award at the ''[[GQ]]'' Men of the Year Awards in 2013.

==Life and career==
===1968–1998: Early life and career beginnings===
Anastacia was born in Chicago, Illinois;<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.anastacia.com/biography |title=Official Website : Biography |publisher=Anastacia |access-date=September 26, 2009 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111003005112/http://www.anastacia.com/biography |archive-date=October 3, 2011  }}</ref> her late father Robert Newkirk (of German descent) was a club-singer and her mother Diane Hurley (of Irish descent) an actress on Broadway.<ref>[http://anastacia-unlimited.org/interview12.php] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081122141350/http://anastacia-unlimited.org/interview12.php|date=November 22, 2008}}</ref> Her parents split up when she was five years old.<ref name=":2">{{Cite web|date=April 28, 2003|first=Michelle|last=Tauber|title=A New Verse|url=https://people.com/archive/a-new-verse-vol-59-no-16/|access-date=December 13, 2021|website=PEOPLE.com|language=en}}</ref> After her father (who had [[bipolar disorder]])<ref>{{cite web|title=Anastacia interview: Welcome to my truth|url=http://www.scotsman.com/what-s-on/music/anastacia-interview-welcome-to-my-truth-1-1301248|work=The Scotsman|publisher=Johnston Publishing Ltd.|access-date=August 22, 2013|date=November 14, 2008}}</ref> left the Newkirk family, they moved to New York City when she was a teenager.<ref name="Times 2005"/> She enrolled at the [[Professional Children's School]] in [[Manhattan]].<ref name="BiographyChannel"/> After graduation, she worked jobs at restaurants and hair salons while pursuing a career in the music industry.<ref name=":2" />

Anastacia was diagnosed with [[Crohn's disease]]<ref name="Times 2005"/><ref name="MTVCancer"/> when she was thirteen. Despite her ongoing health problems Anastacia continued to pursue her ambitions for the next decade. Anastacia started her career in 1983<ref name="mtv.com">{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/artists/anastcia/ |title=Anastácia | New Music And Songs |publisher=MTV |access-date=June 6, 2014}}</ref> as a dancer for hire. Her first claim to fame was as a professional dancer (dancer for hire), making regular appearances in the mid-1980s and early '90s on MTV's ''[[Club MTV]]''.<ref>{{Cite web|date=July 8, 2002|title=Yank on a Mission|url=https://people.com/archive/yank-on-a-mission-vol-58-no-2/|access-date=December 13, 2021|website=people.com|language=en}}</ref> She appeared in two videos for American hip hop trio [[Salt-N-Pepa]] ("Get Up Everybody (Get Up)" in 1988 and "[[Twist and Shout]]" in 1989).<ref name="BiographyChannel">{{cite web|title=Anastacia Biography |url=http://www.thebiographychannel.co.uk/biographies/anastacia.html |work=Bio. |publisher=AETN UK |access-date=August 22, 2013 |quote=The young Anastacia battled against Crohn's disease to develop a career in dance and can be spotted in the early Salt-N-Pepa videos 'Everybody Get Up' and 'Twist and Shout'. |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130921145708/http://www.thebiographychannel.co.uk/biographies/anastacia.html |archive-date=September 21, 2013 }}</ref> In 1990, she started her musical career as a backing vocalist. She sang back-up vocals on pop star [[Tiffany Darwish|Tiffany]]'s ''[[New Inside]]'' album in 1990. In 1991, she featured in music video ''My Fallen Angel'' of Dominican singer/actor [[Coro (singer)|Coro]]. In 1992 she gained her first break as a solo singer on [[Black Entertainment Television|BET]]'s ''[[ComicView]]'', singing [[Oleta Adams]]' "Get Here".<ref>{{cite tweet|user=AnastaciaMusic|author=Anastacia|number=53749838063472640|date=April 1, 2011|title=Wow so true. RT @eTom24: @AnastaciaFanily Wikipedia says: in 1992 you performed Oleta Adam's 'Get Here' on BET's Comic View, true?}}</ref>

In 1993 she moved to Los Angeles to record the song ''One More Chance'' for the producer OG Pierce, it resulted however in no record deal. That same year the singer recorded a collaboration with [[David Morales]] called "Forever Luv". Throughout the mid 1990s producers claimed to be intrigued by her voice's unusual tone, Anastacia would be continuously told that 'her sound just didn't quite fit into any category'. In 1994, she sang back-up vocals on [[Jamie Foxx]] debut album ''[[Peep This]]'', and in 1995 Anastacia sang back-up vocals on [[Paula Abdul]]'s third studio album ''[[Head over Heels (Paula Abdul album)|Head Over Heels]]''. By 1997, Anastacia had become a member of a band called ''The Kraze'' which she remained a part of until 1999. In 1997 she also sung in the background choir for [[Kurt Carr]]'s gospel [[vocal ensemble]] called The Kurt Carr Singers on their album ''No One Else''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.anastacia-archive.de/cds/|archive-url=https://archive.today/20130909101846/http://www.anastacia-archive.de/cds/|url-status=dead|title=CD's - Anastacia-Archive.de|date=September 9, 2013|archive-date=September 9, 2013}}</ref> She had two duet songs with [[Cuba]]n [[composer]] [[Omar Sosa]] in 1998, performing "Mi Negra, Tu Bombón" and "Tienes Un Solo" in 1999.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cduniverse.com/search/xx/music/pid/1206780/a/spirit+of+the+roots.htm |title=Omar Sosa – Spirit of the Roots CD Album |publisher=Cduniverse.com |date=January 26, 1999 |access-date=June 6, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tRIfyRL6aTU | archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211107/tRIfyRL6aTU| archive-date=November 7, 2021 | url-status=live|title=anastacia tienes un solo |publisher=YouTube |date=August 29, 2011 |access-date=June 6, 2014}}{{cbignore}}</ref> Eventually in 1998, before turning 30, Anastacia attracted the interest of record labels after making the finals of the short-lived [[MTV]] talent show ''[[The Cut (1998 TV series)|The Cut]]'' hosted by rapper [[Lisa "Left Eye" Lopes]] .<ref name="Times 2005" /> Anastacia signed a contract with [[Daylight Records]], a custom label of [[Sony Music Entertainment]]'s [[Epic Records]] in March 1999.

===1998–2001: ''Not That Kind''===
Anastacia met Lisa Braude (who later became her manager) in 1997. She encouraged her to join [[MTV]]'s talent show ''[[The Cut (1998 TV series)|The Cut]]'' in 1998. She made her way to be one of the ten finalists, performing her own composition entitled "[[Not That Kind (song)|Not That Kind]]". Even though she did not win the contest, she had successfully impressed some notable artists, such as [[Elton John]] and [[Michael Jackson]] as well as the show's judges that included [[David Foster]] and [[Faith Evans]]. This afterwards led her to sign with [[Daylight Records|Daylight]], one of [[Epic Records|Epic]]'s labels, by March 1999. Backed up by leading American producer/writers, she released her debut album, ''[[Not That Kind]]'' on June 13, 2000. The album reached the top ten in eight countries in Europe and Asia. It went four times platinum in Europe and triple platinum in Australia;<ref name="Australian Certifications 2000">{{cite web|url=http://www.aria.com.au/pages/aria-charts-accreditations-albums-2000.htm |title=Australian Certifications 2000 |publisher=[[Australian Recording Industry Association|ARIA]] |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110611211848/http://www.aria.com.au/pages/aria-charts-accreditations-albums-2000.htm |archive-date=June 11, 2011  }}</ref> her debut single "[[I'm Outta Love]]" was a global smash hit in 2000, topping the charts in Belgium, Australia and New Zealand, peaking at number two in France,<ref name="Anastacia-I'm Outta Love">{{cite web|url=http://dutchcharts.nl//showitem.asp?interpret=Anastacia&titel=I%27m+Outta+Love&cat=s |title=Anastacia-I'm Outta Love |publisher=Dutch Charts.com |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140328195045/http://dutchcharts.nl//jaaroverzichten.asp?year=2013&cat=s |archive-date=March 28, 2014  }}</ref> Switzerland, Italy and Ireland as well as also reaching number six both in Germany<ref>{{cite web|url=http://ki.informatik.uni-wuerzburg.de/~topsi/deu2000/deu_aug00.html|title=German Top 20 – The Chart Of August 2000 |publisher=Infinity Charts}}</ref> and the UK.<ref name="UK Top 40 Hit Database">{{cite web|url=http://www.everyhit.com/searchsec.php |title=UK Top 40 Hit Database |publisher=everyhit.com |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081012195559/http://www.everyhit.com/searchsec.php |archive-date=October 12, 2008  }}</ref> In the U.S., it was only a minor radio hit. The second single "[[Not That Kind (song)|Not That Kind]]" reached number 11 in the UK<ref name="UK Top 40 Hit Database"/> and became a top 10 hit in Italy. It also entered the top 20 in Switzerland and France.<ref name="Anastacia-Not That Kind (Single)">{{cite web|url=http://dutchcharts.nl//showitem.asp?interpret=Anastacia&titel=Not+That+Kind&cat=s |title=Anastacia-Not That Kind (Single) |publisher=Dutch Charts.com |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140328195045/http://dutchcharts.nl//jaaroverzichten.asp?year=2013&cat=s |archive-date=March 28, 2014  }}</ref> "[[Cowboys & Kisses]]" was released as the third single from the album, charting in the top forty in some European countries. As the last promotional only single, "[[Made for Lovin' You (Anastacia song)|Made for Lovin' You]]" charted in the UK at number twenty-seven and in France at number seventy-two. While "I'm Outta Love" was a top ten hit on the [[Hot Dance Club Songs|Hot Dance Club Play]] chart in the United States, "Not That Kind" did not chart on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]]; however by the end of the year Anastacia would go on to be the World's Best Selling New Female Pop Artist at the [[2001 World Music Awards]].<ref>{{cite book|url=https://archive.org/details/bub_gb_DRQEAAAAMBAJ|title=Billboard|date=June 2, 2001|publisher=Nielsen Business Media|via=Internet Archive}}</ref>

===2001–2006: ''Freak of Nature'', ''Anastacia'', breast cancer diagnosis and ''Pieces of a Dream''===
[[File:Anastacia concert.jpg|thumb|left|Anastacia performing live in 2005]]Anastacia's second album ''[[Freak of Nature]]'', released in November 2001, achieved successful sales in the UK where it went triple platinum as well as being a hit throughout continental Europe; however, unlike her debut it did not match the same level of international success. The first single released was "[[Paid My Dues]]". The song became an overall hit, in 2001, peaking in Denmark, Italy, Norway, and Switzerland, and reaching the top ten in several other mainland European countries. The second single, released in 2002, "[[One Day in Your Life (Anastacia song)|One Day in Your Life]]", reached number eleven in the UK and the top ten in many European countries. The next single "[[Why'd You Lie to Me]]" reached the top thirty in the UK. "[[You'll Never Be Alone]]", the fourth single, reached number twenty-eight on the [[Adult Contemporary (chart)|Adult Contemporary]] chart in the U.S. The album was released in the United States in May 2002. Soon after she released a double disc edition featuring two bonus hits, remixes for three of the tracks on the album and two live tracks taken from a Japan gig that was performed on the September 13, 2002. ''[[People (magazine)|People]]'' magazine reviewed her album, writing "Anastacia is most successful when she shifts gears on more reflective, folk-tinged pop-rock tunes such as "Overdue Goodbye" and "How Come the World Won't Stop" on which her more nuanced vocals flow naturally."<ref>{{Cite web|date=June 24, 2002|title=Picks and Pans Review: Freak of Nature|url=https://people.com/archive/picks-and-pans-review-freak-of-nature-vol-57-no-24/|access-date=December 13, 2021|website=people.com|language=en}}</ref>

Anastacia joined [[Celine Dion]], [[Shakira]], [[Cher]], [[Mary J. Blige]], [[Dixie Chicks]], and [[Stevie Nicks]] for ''[[VH1 Divas#VH1 Divas Las Vegas|VH1 Divas Las Vegas]]'' in 2002<ref>{{Cite web |last=Aquilante |first=Dan |date=2002-05-17 |title=HER VOICE, HER LOOKS MAKE ANASTACIA . . . ONE CHIC 'FREAK' |url=https://nypost.com/2002/05/17/her-voice-her-looks-make-anastacia-one-chic-freak/ |access-date=2022-07-15 |website=New York Post |language=en-US}}</ref> and she also contributed the song "Love Is a Crime" to the ''[[Chicago (2002 film)|Chicago]]'' soundtrack.<ref name="MTVCancer">{{cite news|last=Kaufman|first=Gil|title=Anastacia Diagnosed With Breast Cancer|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1459603/anastacia-has-breast-cancer.jhtml|access-date=August 22, 2013|newspaper=[[MTV]]|date=January 21, 2003}}</ref> The song peaked at number one on the [[Hot Dance Club Play]] chart and enjoyed moderate airplay on Rhythmic/Dance format. Anastacia was also asked to sing the official song for the [[2002 FIFA World Cup]] in South Korea and Japan and subsequently performed this at the opening ceremony.

In January 2003, Anastacia decided to have her [[breast reduction plasty|breasts reduced]] because of back strain. From a routine [[mammography|mammogram]] for the surgery she discovered she had breast cancer.<ref>{{Cite web|date=October 2, 2013|first=Wade|last=Rouse|title=Anastacia Recovering from Double Mastectomy|url=https://people.com/celebrity/anastacia-recovering-from-double-mastectomy/|access-date=December 13, 2021|website=people.com|language=en}}</ref> She immediately started and successfully completed surgery and [[radiation therapy|radiotherapy]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Pop singer Anastacia undergoes cancer surgery|url=http://badgerherald.com/artsetc/2003/03/04/pop_singer_anastacia.php|access-date=August 22, 2013|newspaper=The Badger Herald|date=March 4, 2003|agency=Reuters|location=Los Angeles}}</ref> Anastacia subsequently established the Anastacia Fund to promote awareness of breast cancer among younger women.<ref name="Times 2005">{{cite web|last=Barrell|first=Tony|title=The trials of Anastacia|url=http://www.thesundaytimes.co.uk/sto/style/article152070.ece|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140527214653/http://www.thesundaytimes.co.uk/sto/style/article152070.ece|url-status=dead|archive-date=May 27, 2014|work=[[The Sunday Times]]|access-date=August 22, 2013|date=October 23, 2005}} {{subscription required|s}}</ref> She has attributed her health scare as being an inspiration for the sound and content of her third album. According to an interview she gave in 2005 on British music station [[The Box (UK and Ireland)|The Box]], her voice lost its power and she became unable to record, and thus she spent a long time writing and trying to create a sound that she finally became happy with.

As stated on the Australian talk show ''[[Rove (TV series)|Rove]]'' in 2004, Anastacia wanted to have more edge to her vocals as she felt there was something missing from her previous works. She brought in rock instruments that brought a new atmosphere to her music. She also felt that she still needed the funkiness and pop as the singer felt that too much edge would sound wrong with her voice. Out of this a new sound was formed. She describes her sound as Sprock—a combination of [[soul music|soul]], pop, and rock. She named the album after herself. Anastacia entered record studios in September 2003 to begin recording her next album, working with [[Glen Ballard]], [[Dallas Austin]], and [[David A. Stewart]] for release in 2004. On the album, Anastacia also collaborated with [[P.O.D.]] lead singer [[Sonny Sandoval]] on the socially conscious track "I Do".

The first single, released in March, was "[[Left Outside Alone]]", which saw a change in direction for Anastacia. It was one of the biggest songs in Europe of 2004, reaching number one in Austria, Italy, Spain, and Switzerland; number two in Denmark, Germany, Ireland, the Netherlands, and Norway; and number three in the United Kingdom and Hungary. Overall the song remained at number one on the European ''Billboard'' singles chart for 15 weeks.<ref name="anastacia.com"/> The song also topped the Australian charts, Anastacia's second number one in the country, where it went on to become the second-biggest-selling single of 2004.

''[[Anastacia (album)|Anastacia]]'' quickly became her most successful album to date, giving her a third consecutive triple platinum album in the UK and reaching the top of the national charts in Ireland, the Netherlands, Australia, Greece, Germany and other countries. Unlike her first two albums, which were released in her homeland of America, ''Anastacia'' was not, despite being scheduled for release on three occasions. "[[Left Outside Alone]]" was released twice, but failed to pick up heavy airplay.<ref name="BiographyChannel"/> It only gained sporadic [[Adult Contemporary (chart)|Adult Contemporary]] format airplay. Again, it sparked [[Rhythmic (chart)|Rhythmic/Dance]] format airplay and the dance mix of "Left Outside Alone" peaked at number five on the [[Hot Dance Club Songs|Hot Dance Club Play]] chart. After the original version of "Left Outside Alone" failed to catch on because of lukewarm promotion, especially on radio, the album was postponed and eventually cancelled after the release date of August 30, 2004, passed. Anastacia released three further internationally successful singles; "[[Sick and Tired (Anastacia song)|Sick and Tired]]" (which gave her another number one in Spain and another UK top five single), "[[Welcome to My Truth]]" (her best-selling hit in Spain), and the ballad "[[Heavy on My Heart]]", sales of which went towards the Anastacia Fund (a charitable organization providing [[research funding]] for breast cancer).[[File:Heavy Rotation 3.jpg|thumb|Anastacia performing live in 2005|254x254px]]A small batch of [[Anastacia (album)|her self-titled album]] was released with a bonus DVD, poster and slip case. The DVD includes a making-of documentary, footage from her 2002 Europe Promo Tour, and a photo gallery. From September 2004 to August 2005, Anastacia embarked on the [[Live at Last Tour]]. In 2005 the tour was renamed the Encore Tour. The tour would become the second most popular tour of 2004 behind only U2.<ref name="anastacia.com"/>

In late 2005, she released her first greatest hits collection, called ''[[Pieces of a Dream (Anastacia album)|Pieces of a Dream]]'', named after a track of the same name. The album spawned the hit singles "[[Pieces of a Dream (Anastacia song)|Pieces of a Dream]]", which peaked at number one in Spain, and the duet with [[Eros Ramazzotti]], "[[I Belong to You (Il Ritmo della Passione)]]", which was a number 1 hit in Germany, Hungary, Italy and Switzerland and a hit throughout continental Europe. Even though [[Sony BMG]] did force her to release this collection, Anastacia has said that she is happy now that it was created as it was like a "story book", or summary of the first six years of her career. In 2005, she was recognized for worldwide sales of over 20 million.<ref name="JME award">{{cite web|title=Anastacia, 20 million worldwide sales award |url=http://jmenternational.com/work/awards/2005/anastacia/ |work=JM Enternational |access-date=August 22, 2013 |date=November 2, 2005 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131004223432/http://jmenternational.com/work/awards/2005/anastacia/ |archive-date=October 4, 2013 }}</ref>

Not long after the release of "I Belong to You (Il Ritmo Della Passione)", Anastacia released her first live DVD ''[[Live at Last (Anastacia video)|Live at Last]]'' on March 27, 2006, in Europe. The DVD contains footage from concerts in Berlin and [[Munich]]. It includes music videos to her four singles; "[[Left Outside Alone]]", "[[Everything Burns]]", "Pieces of a Dream", and "I Belong to You (Il Ritmo Della Passione)", five alternative videos ("I Do", "Rearview", "Seasons Change", "Underground Army", and "[[Time (Anastacia song)|Time]]") to songs from her self-titled album, and a documentary about the tour. Soon after the DVD release Anastacia took a break from the music industry and began concentrating on her growing fashion line with s. Oliver.

=== 2007–2013: ''Heavy Rotation'', collaborations, ''It's a Man's World'' and second breast cancer ===
[[File:Anastacia, Women's World Awards 2009 d.jpg|left|thumb|Anastacia at the [[Women's World Award]] 2009 ([[Wiener Stadthalle]], [[Vienna]], Austria) where she received the 'World Artist Award'|301x301px]]
Anastacia attended the memorial [[Concert for Diana]] on July 1, 2007, which would have been on Diana's forty-sixth birthday. This was one of the first major events to take place in the new [[Wembley Stadium]], and one of her first major appearances since she took a break from the industry. She opened the medley section of the show and she sang a rendition of "[[Superstar (Jesus Christ Superstar song)|Superstar]]", from [[Andrew Lloyd Webber]]'s ''[[Jesus Christ Superstar]]'', with a [[gospel music|gospel]] chorus behind her.
In August 2007, a video was put on the "Anastacia by S. Oliver" web site. During the video, when Anastacia was asked about her future plans, she confirmed that she was working on an album as well as the clothing line. A specific month of release or title was not mentioned.<ref>{{cite web|title=August 2007 video on the Anastacia section of the "Anastacia by s oliver" website|url=http://www.anastaciabysoliver.com/|publisher=Anastaciabysoliver.com|access-date=February 21, 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130518174822/http://anastaciabysoliver.com/|archive-date=May 18, 2013|url-status=dead}}</ref> In November 2007, her biography on the official Anastacia website<ref name=OfficialBio>[http://www.anastacia.com/bio.html Biography page] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071205025217/http://www.anastacia.com/bio.html |date=December 5, 2007 }} Official Anastacia web site.</ref> was updated to say there would be an album in 2008, with a tour to follow. It was in this period also that Anastacia left Sony and moved to Mercury. During an interview for the UK breakfast show ''This Morning'', the singer cited that David Massey's move from Sony to Mercury was key to her own label change due to the fact that Massey had originally signed her and had been involved in all of her previous albums.

On July 24, Anastacia announced that her fourth studio album ''[[Heavy Rotation (Anastacia album)|Heavy Rotation]]'' would be released in Europe and Asia on October 27, 2008 (and elsewhere in 2009). The album featured collaborations with producers [[Ne-Yo]], The Heavyweights, [[Lester Mendez]], [[J.R. Rotem]], and [[Rodney Jerkins]], and was a noted departure from the pop rock sound of her previous material. The album's first single, called "[[I Can Feel You]]", began playing in some radio markets on August 25, 2008.<ref name="MTVAsia0808">[http://www.mtvasia.com/News/200808/21016468.html Anastacia Is Back With Fourth Studio Album 'Heavy Rotation'] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090319021444/http://www.mtvasia.com/News/200808/21016468.html |date=March 19, 2009 }}. (August 21, 2008) MTV Asia. Retrieved August 25, 2008.</ref> The second single from ''Heavy Rotation'' was "[[Absolutely Positively]]", later served as a promotional single only. The third official single from the album, "Defeated", was released as a promotional single in Europe without a music video.

Her fourth studio album proved to be less successful than her previous ones; her singles failed to reach the top 40 in her most commercially successful country (UK). Anastacia however remained positive, stating that other artists have faced the same problems while changing a record label, also blaming the world [[Great Recession|economical crisis]] and the label's decision to alter her sound from her own chosen sprock{{typo help inline|reason=similar to sprack|date=October 2022}} sound of her previous record to a more "urban feel". In later years Anastacia would publicly admit regret towards the change of sound, citing personal problems that led to a creative [[Selling out|sell-out]]. Regardless of the lack of commercial success, the album was ranked number ten on ''Billboard'' magazine's online "Readers' Poll: 10 Best Albums of 2008". In 2009, the [[Women's World Award]] presented Anastacia with the World Artist Award, recognizing the singer's success and ongoing positive influence in pop music.

In June 2009, Anastacia began her second tour throughout Europe to promote her fourth studio album. The tour was funded by the singer herself, not her label, and was well received by critics and fans alike.<ref>{{cite web|last=Sullivan|first=Caroline|title=Pop review: Anastacia, Hammersmith Apollo, London|url=https://www.theguardian.com/music/2009/jun/27/anastacia-hammersmith-apollo-review|work=[[The Guardian]]|access-date=August 22, 2013|date=June 27, 2009}}</ref> In November and December 2009 Anastacia, [[Chaka Khan]] and [[Lulu (singer)|Lulu]] were headlining the ''[[Here Come the Girls (concert tour)|Here Come the Girls]]'' a special Christmas concert that visited the United Kingdom only.

On December 7, 2009, Anastacia opened the annual ''[[Royal Variety Performance]]'' with [[Lulu (singer)|Lulu]] and [[Chaka Khan]], performing a rendition of "[[Relight My Fire]]".<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/uk_news/england/lancashire/8398060.stm|title=Blackpool Royal Variety performers entertain Queen|work=BBC News|date=December 8, 2009|access-date=December 17, 2009|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20091213124119/http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/uk_news/england/lancashire/8398060.stm|archive-date=December 13, 2009 |url-status= live}}</ref> The tour was an overall success, selling out 24 shows.<ref name="anastacia.com"/> In October 2009, Anastacia released a collaborative single with British band [[Ben's Brother]] entitled "[[Stalemate (song)|Stalemate]]", which was included on the band's album ''Battling Giants''.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.bensbrother.com/shop.php |title=Battling Giants |website=Ben's Brother |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110707224209/http://www.bensbrother.com/shop.php |archive-date=July 7, 2011}}</ref>
During the winter of 2009, Anastacia once again joined [[Lulu (singer)|Lulu]] for the Here Come the Girls Tour with [[Heather Small]] replacing Chaka Khan. In March 2010, Anastacia again entered the recording studio. Around this time, she also headlined several shows at Art on Ice in [[Zürich]], the [[Hallenstadion]] and [[Lausanne]]. Her official website stated about the show: "In a unique, groundbreaking combination of Olympic-level figure skating and smash hit pop, the music of Anastacia will soundtrack and seamlessly inspire a performance from some of the world's best figure skaters, perfectly choreographed to complement her hits."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://anastacia.com/news/0-6/anastacia-art-on-ice |title=Official Website : News |publisher=Anastacia |access-date=March 7, 2010 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100304120649/http://www.anastacia.com/news/0-6/anastacia-art-on-ice |archive-date=March 4, 2010 }}</ref>

During the summer of 2010 Anastacia also became one of the main judges on British talent series ''[[Don't Stop Believing (TV series)|Don't Stop Believing]]'', a contest inspired by the musical comedy-drama ''[[Glee (TV series)|Glee]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://dontstopbelieving.five.tv/team |title=Home | Channel 5 |publisher=Dontstopbelieving.five.tv |access-date=March 25, 2012 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100716185916/http://dontstopbelieving.five.tv/team |archive-date=July 16, 2010 }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.anastacia.com/news|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100718140909/http://anastacia.com/news/0-6/all-star-line-up-joins-dont-stop-believing/0-6|url-status=dead|title=News|archive-date=July 18, 2010|website=Anastacia.com}}</ref> During promotion for the reality show the singer noted that she had left Mercury Records and was then with no label. Following "Stalemate", Anastacia released "Safety", a duet with Russian singer [[Dima Bilan]], recorded in Los Angeles in May 2010. The song was performed live for the first time at the [[Muz-TV]] Music Awards Moscow in June 2010. The song was released as a single in [[Russia]] in August 2010. On August 13, Anastacia announced that she would join Belgian singer [[Natalia (Belgian singer)|Natalia Druyts]] for a joint tour, Natalia Meets Anastacia, for six arena shows which were performed at the Sportpaleis, Belgium. On August 17, Natalia and Anastacia recorded a collaborative single, "[[Burning Star (song)|Burning Star]]", which was released on September 17, 2010, as promotion for the concert series.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://anastacia.com/news/0-6/natalia-meets-anastacia/0-6 |url-status=dead |title=News |website=Anastacia |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100718140900/http://www.anastacia.com/news/0-6/natalia-meets-anastacia/0-6 |archive-date=July 18, 2010 |access-date=July 14, 2010}}</ref> On November 13, Anastacia became the first international singer ever to perform a concert in Northern Cyprus, which is occupied by Turkish forces.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.ntvmsnbc.com/id/25151276/ |title=KKTC'de tarihi konser – Kıbrıs |publisher=ntvmsnbc.com |access-date=March 25, 2012 |archive-date=December 9, 2014 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141209201315/http://www.ntvmsnbc.com/id/25151276/ |url-status=dead }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.ntvmsnbc.com/id/25150741/ |title=Rum lobisini dinlemedi – Kıbrıs |publisher=ntvmsnbc.com |access-date=March 25, 2012 |archive-date=December 9, 2014 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141209201638/http://www.ntvmsnbc.com/id/25150741/ |url-status=dead }}</ref> In February 2011, Anastacia was a guest at the [[Gigi D'Alessio]] concert at [[Radio City Music Hall]] in New York, performing as an opening act. On November 11, 2011, she performed in Madrid for the SAP Sapphire Conference.
[[File:Anastacia in Prague 2012.jpg|thumb|285x285px|Anastacia in [[Prague]], [[Czech Republic]] in 2012]]
In June 2012, Anastacia was confirmed as a guest judge for the ninth series of ''[[The X Factor (British TV series)|The X Factor UK]]'' at the [[Glasgow]] auditions alongside judges [[Louis Walsh]], [[Gary Barlow]] and [[Tulisa Contostavlos]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.breakingnews.ie/entertainment/anastacia-set-for-guest-x-factor-slot-554510.html|title=Anastacia set for guest 'X Factor' slot|date=June 7, 2012 |publisher=BreakingNews.ie|access-date=June 7, 2012}}</ref> Her appearance on the show was heavily praised with sources stating that she had "great chemistry" with the others and had greatly impressed the producers, causing speculation that the singer would become the new fourth judge.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.co.uk/news/the-x-factor/356766-the-x-factor-anastacia-nicole-scherzinger-gary-tulisa?s_cid=424html |title=Anastacia Impresses At X Factor Auditions In Glasgow | MTV UK |publisher=Mtv.co.uk |date=April 22, 2014 |access-date=June 6, 2014}}</ref> However it was later revealed that the singer was forced to reject the judging offer due to contractual agreements regarding the Night of the Proms European winter tour as well of the release of her independent cover album.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.standard.co.uk/showbiz/anastacia-reveals-she-turned-down-x-factor-judge-offer-7945710.html |title=Anastacia reveals she turned down X Factor judge offer – Showbiz|work=London Evening Standard|date=July 16, 2012|access-date=June 6, 2014}}</ref>

During summer 2012, Anastacia toured throughout Europe.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.anastacia.com/events |url-status=dead |title=Tour |website=Anastacia |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120606082810/http://www.anastacia.com/events |archive-date=June 6, 2012 |access-date=June 10, 2012}}</ref> In July 2012, Anastacia announced on her Twitter page<ref>{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/AnastaciaFanily/statuses/221754319798673408 |title=Twitter / AnastaciaFanily: Single released will B w/the |publisher=Twitter.com |date=July 7, 2012 |access-date=February 21, 2013}}</ref> (and Facebook fan page<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.facebook.com/Anastacia |title=Anastacia |publisher=Facebook |access-date=February 21, 2013}}</ref>) the release of a new commercial single for car company [[Škoda Auto]]. She performed the song "What Can We Do (Deeper Love)" for the first time on July 10 in the Jazz Festival in Montreaux, Switzerland. The deal included the release of her following two albums, ''[[It's a Man's World (Anastacia album)|It's a Man's World]]'', a collection of covers of songs by male rock artists released on November 9, 2012, followed by an album of original material.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bmg.com/category/news/?n=ger-anastacia-chooses-bmg-to-release-next-two-albums |title=News | BMG Music Rights Management |publisher=Bmg.com |access-date=February 21, 2013 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130127024339/http://www.bmg.com/category/news/?n=ger-anastacia-chooses-bmg-to-release-next-two-albums |archive-date=January 27, 2013 }}</ref>

Throughout November and December 2012 Anastacia took part in the annual Night of the Proms, a series of concerts held in Belgium, the Netherlands, and Germany which combine classical music with famous pop songs. She also stated it would mark a return to her "sprock" sound.

===2014–2015: ''Resurrection'' and ''Ultimate Collection''===
[[File:Anastacia - Resurrection Tour 2015 (Sydney) 03.jpg|left|thumb|Anastacia performing on The Resurrection Tour (2015) in [[Sydney|Sydney, Australia]]|244x244px]]
The album, entitled ''[[Resurrection (Anastacia album)|Resurrection]]'', was released in May 2014 and was met with both critical and commercial success, giving the singer her sixth top ten Italian album and fifth top ten UK album. It also reached the top 5 of the Swiss and German charts and the top ten of the Dutch charts. Reviews were overwhelmingly positive, acknowledging a return to form from the singer as well as a creative resurgence. The lead single "[[Stupid Little Things]]" was released on April 4, 2014. The single was moderately successful, reaching the top ten in Belgium and top 20 in Italy. It was quickly met with a positive reaction from music critics, with [[MTV]]'s Brad Stern naming it one of the "5 Must-Hear Pop Songs of the Week!" and calling it a "return to form" for the "[[pop princess]] and proof that Anastacia's a true survivor", after her second battle with breast cancer.<ref>{{cite web |first=Brad |last=Stern |url=http://buzzworthy.mtv.com/2014/03/25/wrathschild-fefe-dobson-guy-sebastian// |title=Wrathschild, Fefe Dobson, Guy Sebastian + More: 5 Must-Hear Pop Songs Of The Week |publisher=Buzzworthy.mtv.com |date=March 25, 2014 |access-date=June 6, 2014 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140329130318/http://buzzworthy.mtv.com/2014/03/25/wrathschild-fefe-dobson-guy-sebastian/ |archive-date=March 29, 2014  }}</ref> Anastacia was given the German Radio Regenbogen Award for Charity and Entertainment in April 2014.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.derwesten.de/panorama/musikpreise-fuer-anastacia-und-milky-chance-id9235043.html |title=Musikpreise für Anastacia und Milky Chance | WAZ.de |date=April 11, 2014 |language=de |publisher=Derwesten.de |access-date=June 6, 2014}}</ref>

In June 2014, Anastacia announced that due to a [[hernia]] procedure she would be unable to promote the album for a number of weeks.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.anastacia.com/doctors-orders/|title=Under Doctor's Orders|website=Anastacia.com}}</ref> After returning to her promotional tour Anastacia played numerous festivals throughout Europe including headlining [[Manchester Pride]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/whats-on/music-nightlife-news/manchester-pride-announces-first-headline-7297009|title=Manchester Pride announces first headline acts, including Anastacia, All Saints and Foxes|first=Dianne|last=Bourne|date=June 20, 2014|website=Manchestereveningnews.co.uk}}</ref> which was heavily praised.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/whats-on/whats-on-news/review-anastacia--manchester-pride-7660826|title=Review: @Anastaciafanily at @ManchesterPride 2014 #FeelTheLove|first=Dianne|last=Bourne|date=August 22, 2014|website=Manchestereveningnews.co.uk}}</ref> She was also named as one of the judges on the German talent show ''Rising Star''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rtl.de/cms/sendungen/show/rising-star/news/rising-star-2014-diese-castingshow-ist-besonders-so-jury-mitglied-sasha-3dd8d-c689-91-1981696.html|title=Diese Castingshow ist besonders!|website=Rtl.de}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rtl.de/cms/sendungen/show/rising-star/news/rising-star-2014-das-grosse-finale-bereits-am-18-september-4035f-c689-20-2051918.html|title=21 Talente im großen Finale|website=Rtl.de}}</ref> In November 2014, Anastacia began her [[Resurrection Tour]], her first tour to include Australia.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/music/news/a660313/anastacia-announces-her-ultimate-collection.html#~pnIbeiJc8iWBtX|title=Anastacia announces her Ultimate Collection|date=July 27, 2015|website=Digitalspy.co.uk}}</ref> The tour ended in September 2015 after 80 shows and was well received by fans and critics. During this period it was also announced that Anastacia had re-signed with her original label and that a compilation album would be released.

Anastacia's ''[[The Ultimate Collection (Anastacia album)|Ultimate Collection]]'' was released in November 2015 and peaked in the top ten of the UK charts, giving the singer her 6th top ten album in Britain. During the same month Anastacia attended The Children For Peace Gala at Spazio Novecento in Rome where she received the special artist award.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.vanityfair.it/onstage/15/12/02/the-children-for-peace-dinner-gala-roma-anastacia-vip-foto|title=The Children For Peace e Anastacia per i bambini|website=VanityFair.it|date=December 2, 2015 }}</ref> As of 2016, she has sold over 52 million albums worldwide.

==Philanthropy==
Anastacia has supported many [[nonprofit organization]]s and attended various charity events such as [[Life Ball]] in 2006 (Europe's largest annual AIDS charity event), [[Make A Difference|Make a Difference]] and Challenge for the Children. Anastacia was one of the fifteen artists to record their take on a Disney song on the [[compilation album]] ''[[Disneymania]]'' (2002). Anastacia recorded "Someday My Prince Will Come" from ''[[Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs (1937 film)|Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs]]''. It is also included on the Collector's Edition of her second album.

In 2003, Anastacia took part in the charity event, [[46664]], organized by [[Nelson Mandela]] to raise awareness of AIDS. She sang with [[U2]] and [[Queen (band)|Queen]], and also contributed to the song "Amandla", recording the song and providing some of the lyrics. [[Annie Lennox]] joined forces with Anastacia and 22 other female artists to raise awareness of the transmission of HIV to unborn children in Africa.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.annielennoxsing.com |title=Sing |publisher=Annielennoxsing.com |access-date=September 26, 2009| archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20090914212912/http://www.annielennoxsing.com/| archive-date=September 14, 2009 | url-status= live}}</ref> The single "Sing" was released on [[World AIDS Day]], December 1, 2007, in conjunction with Annie Lennox's appearance at the Nelson Mandela 46664 concert in South Africa.
After being diagnosed with cancer, Anastacia created "The Anastacia Fund" in partnership with [[Estée Lauder Companies|Estée Lauder]]. The organization helps raise awareness about breast cancer and the importance of mammograms to women 35 and under.<ref name=":3">{{Cite web|last=Sulway|first=Verity|date=November 23, 2021|title=What happened to Anastacia - double cancer battle, TV controversy and divorce|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/3am/celebrity-news/what-happened-singer-anastacia-double-25524626|access-date=December 13, 2021|website=mirror|language=en}}</ref> Anastacia began selling her stage clothing on [[eBay]], donating a portion to the [[Breast Cancer Research Foundation]]. The auctions were hosted by an eBay Trading Assistant and Certified Business Consultant. New listings began every Friday for 6 months.

In 2008, she performed at the "Pink Ribbon Gala" in [[Stockholm]], she appeared on "Divas II", a benefit concert along with many other female artists as well as performing at the [[ChildLine Concert]] in Dublin.

==Personal life==
[[File:Anastacia, Women's World Awards 2009 b.jpg|thumb|Anastacia has several tattoos]]
Over the course of her life Anastacia has battled numerous health problems including being diagnosed with [[Crohn's disease]] at age 13, [[breast cancer]] at age 34, and the heart condition [[supraventricular tachycardia]], which the singer discovered she had at age 39. In February 2013, it was announced that Anastacia was battling a more intense form of breast cancer. In recognition of her decade-long charitable efforts in breast cancer awareness, Anastacia became only the second woman to be presented with the Humanitarian Award at the ''[[GQ]]'' Men of the Year Awards in 2013.

Anastacia married her [[bodyguard]] Wayne Newton in [[Huatulco]], Mexico, on April 21, 2007.<ref>{{Cite web|date=May 14, 2007|first=Tiffany|last=McGee|title=Fairy Tale Ending|url=https://people.com/archive/fairy-tale-ending-vol-67-no-19/|access-date=December 13, 2021|website=PEOPLE.com|language=en}}</ref> She became a step-mother to his two children from a previous relationship.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.com/showbiz/news/a217439/anastacia-to-divorce-bodyguard/|title=Anastacia to divorce bodyguard?|date=April 30, 2010|work=Digital Spy|access-date=July 22, 2018|language=en}}</ref> In April 2010, it was confirmed that the two had filed a petition for divorce.<ref>{{cite news|title=EXCLUSIVE: Singer Anastacia Files For Divorce|url=http://radaronline.com/exclusives/2010/04/exclusive-singer-anastacia-files-divorce/|access-date=August 22, 2013|newspaper=Radar Online|date=April 28, 2010|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100502022547/http://www.radaronline.com/exclusives/2010/04/exclusive-singer-anastacia-files-divorce|archive-date=May 2, 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last=Davies|first=Rebecca|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/showbiz/news/a217439/anastacia-to-divorce-bodyguard.html|title=Anastacia to divorce bodyguard?|newspaper=Digital Spy|date=April 30, 2010|access-date=April 30, 2010|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100503140305/http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/showbiz/news/a217439/anastacia-to-divorce-bodyguard.html|archive-date=May 3, 2010}}</ref>

Anastacia has several [[tattoo]]s on her back, and one below her neck saying "Forever" in an unusual font. In 2008 she added wings to this tattoo.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.funtrivia.com/en/Music/Anastacia-10071.html |title=Anastacia |publisher=FunTrivia.com |access-date=September 26, 2009 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090415063924/http://www.funtrivia.com/en/Music/Anastacia-10071.html |archive-date=April 15, 2009 |url-status=dead  }}</ref> She also has an [[ankh]] on her lower back, which appeared on her first album. Since it represents eternal life, to her fans it has come to symbolize her.<ref name="Times 2005"/> Her third tattoo is at the base of her neck just above "Forever" and is her only coloured tattoo. It says A&W to symbolise her marriage to Wayne Newton. Although the pair are now divorced Anastacia has said she does not regret the tattoo.<ref name=":3" />

Anastacia lived in [[Beverly Hills, California|Beverly Hills]] for over a decade,<ref>{{Cite web|date=April 12, 2018|title=Singer Anastacia puts her Beverly Hills home back up for sale at $3 million|url=https://www.latimes.com/business/realestate/hot-property/la-fi-hotprop-anastacia-beverly-hills-20180412-story.html|access-date=December 14, 2021|website=Los Angeles Times|language=en-US}}</ref> but relocated to [[Florida]] in 2018.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.anastaciafanily.com/anastacia-arrived-in-malta-interview-for-signal107/|title=Anastacia arrived in Malta today for her next show!|date=June 4, 2018|work=Official Anastacia Fanclub|access-date=July 22, 2018}}</ref>
